intro: Isolepis panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian sedge, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, rushes, and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of water bodies. Its slender, triangular stems are often covered in fine, grass-like leaves. Isolepis panamensis produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are characteristic of the sedge family.
